Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

Steven and Dan,

I have just added support for what you want to do.  Update to the  
latest CVS version, then look at the demo program Cantera/cxx/demos/ 
NASA_coeffs.cpp to see how to do it.  At present, this can only be  
done from C++.

Dave


On Nov 5, 2006, at 6:37 PM, Steven C. DeCaluwe wrote:

> Hi, Dan,
>
> I was just wondering--have you had any luck in updating the thermo  
> coefficients 'on the fly,' as it were?
>
> I'm looking into doing the same, through the Matlab interface, and  
> was wondering if you (or any other Cantera users)  had any advice/ 
> tips.  The 'reportParams' call does seem to output the  
> coefficients, but it looks like the 'update' call simply updates  
> the thermo for a new temperature--is this correct?
>
> Thanks,
> ~Steven DeCaluwe
>
>
> ----- Original Message ----
> From: Dan Smyth <das69@...>
> To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Friday, October 13, 2006 1:27:36 PM
> Subject: [cantera] Re: Accessing thermodynamic fit coefficients....
>
> I believe that I finally found these calls (reportParams and update).
> We'll try it.
>
> Dan Smyth
>
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups .com, "Dan Smyth" <das69@...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > I am using Cantera on a Linux box to replace Chemkin calls within a
> > Fortran code and ran into something that I cannot figure out. We  
> need
> > to be able to access the sixth thermodynamic coefficient of the  
> lower
> > temperature fit for a given component. This value is altered in our
> > code to change the reference enthalpy value for a given ingredient.
> > In our case (in which we are modeling solid rocket propellants) the
> > enthalpy reference value sometimes needs to be altered to take into
> > account an enthalpy change associated with the addition of a
> > particular type of curative in a given amount. We have found it is
> > easier to change this value on the fly rather than to change the  
> input
> > values in the mechanism file. I was curious if there is currently  
> any
> > way to access these values from within Cantera. If not, is there  
> some
> > way to get this built in? We need to be able to change the value of
> > this coefficient, and not just get its value. Thanks.
> >
> > Dan Smyth
> >
>
>
>
>
> 


--Apple-Mail-1--163736476
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/html;
	charset=ISO-8859-1
